verses.verse: The burden<WH4853> of Egypt<WH4714>. Behold<WH3068>, the Lord rides<WH7392> upon a swift<WH7031> cloud<WH5645>, and shall come<WH935> into Egypt<WH4714>: and the idols<WH457> of Egypt<WH4714> shall be moved<WH5128> at his presence<WH6440>, and the heart<WH3824> of Egypt<WH4714> shall melt<WH4549> in the midst of it<WH7130>.

And I will set<WH5526> the Egyptians<WH4714> against the Egyptians<WH4714>: and they shall fight<WH3898> every one<WH376> against his brother<WH251>, and every one<WH376> against his neighbor<WH7453>; city<WH5892> against city<WH5892>, and kingdom<WH4467> against kingdom<WH4467>.

And the spirit<WH7307> of Egypt<WH4714> shall fail<WH1238> in the midst<WH7130> there<WH1104>; and I will destroy the counsel<WH6098> there<WH1875>: and they shall seek to the idols<WH457>, and to the charmers<WH328>, and to them that have familiar spirits<WH178>, and to the wizards<WH3049>.

And<WH853> the Egyptians<WH4714> will I give over<WH5534> into the hand<WH3027> of a cruel<WH7186> lord<WH113>; and a fierce<WH5794> king<WH4428> shall rule<WH4910> over them<WH5002>, says the Lord<WH113>, the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>.
And the waters<WH4325> shall fail<WH5405> from the sea<WH3220>, and the river<WH5104> shall be wasted<WH2717> and dried up<WH3001>.

And they shall turn<WH2186> the rivers<WH5104> far away<WH2186>; and the brooks<WH2975> of defense<WH4693> shall be emptied<WH1809> and dried up<WH2717>: the reeds<WH7070> and reeds<WH5488> shall wither<WH7060>.

The paper reeds<WH6169> by the brooks<WH2975>, by the mouth<WH6310> of the brooks<WH2975>, and every thing sown<WH4218> by the brooks<WH2975>, shall wither<WH3001>, be driven away<WH5086>, and be no more.

The fishers<WH1771> also shall mourn<WH578>, and all they that cast<WH7993> angle<WH2443> into the brooks<WH2975> shall lament<WH56>, and they that spread<WH6566> nets<WH4365> upon<WH6440> the waters<WH4325> shall languish<WH535>.
Moreover they that work<WH5647> in fine<WH8305> flax<WH6593>, and they that weave<WH707> cloth<WH2355>, shall be confounded<WH954>.
And they shall be broken<WH1792> in the purposes<WH8356> there<WH6213>, all that make sluices<WH7938> and ponds<WH99> for fish<WH5315>.

Surely the princes<WH8269> of Zoan<WH6814> are fools<WH191>, the counsel<WH6098> of the wise<WH2450> counselors<WH3289> of Pharaoh<WH6547> is become brutish<WH1197>: how say<WH559> you unto Pharaoh<WH6547>, I am the son<WH1121> of the wise<WH2450>, the son<WH1121> of ancient<WH6924> kings<WH4428>?

Where<WH335> are they<WH645>? where are your wise<WH2450> men<WH5046>? and let them tell you now<WH3045>, and let them know what the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> has purposed<WH3289> upon Egypt<WH4714>.

The princes<WH8269> of Zoan<WH6814> are become fools<WH2973>, the princes<WH8269> of Noph<WH5297> are deceived<WH5377>; they have also seduced<WH8582> Egypt<WH4714>, even they that are the pinnacle<WH6438> of the tribes there<WH7626>.

The Lord<WH3068> has mingled<WH4537> a perverse<WH5773> spirit<WH7307> in the midst<WH7130> there<WH4714>: and they have caused Egypt to err<WH8582> in every work<WH4639> there<WH7910>, as a drunken man staggers<WH8582> in his vomit<WH6892>.
Neither shall there be any work<WH4639> for Egypt<WH4714>, which the head<WH7218> or tail<WH2180>, branch<WH3712> or rush<WH100>, may do<WH6213>.

In that day<WH3117> shall Egypt<WH4714> be like unto women<WH802>: and it shall be afraid<WH2729> and fear<WH6342> because<WH6440> of the shaking<WH8573> of the hand<WH3027> of the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, which he shakes over it<WH5130>.

And the land<WH127> of Judah<WH3063> shall be a terror<WH2283> unto Egypt<WH4714>, every one that makes mention<WH2142> there shall be afraid<WH6342> in himself<WH6440>, because of the counsel<WH6098> of the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, which he has determined against it<WH3289>.

In that day<WH3117> shall five<WH2568> cities<WH5892> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> speak<WH1696> the language<WH8193> of Canaan<WH3667>, and swear<WH7650> to the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>; one<WH259> shall be called<WH559>, The city<WH5892> of destruction<WH2041>.

In that day<WH3117> shall there be a altar<WH4196> to the Lord<WH3068> in the midst<WH8432> of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, and a pillar<WH4676> at<WH681> the border<WH1366> there to the Lord<WH3068>.

And it shall be for a sign<WH226> and for a witness<WH5707> unto the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>: for they shall cry<WH6817> unto the Lord<WH3068> because<WH6440> of the oppressors<WH3905>, and he shall send<WH7971> them a savior<WH3467>, and a great one<WH7227>, and he shall deliver them<WH5337>.

And the Lord<WH3068> shall be known<WH3045> to Egypt<WH4714>, and the Egyptians<WH4714> shall know<WH3045> the Lord<WH3068> in that day<WH3117>, and shall do<WH5647> sacrifice<WH2077> and oblation<WH4503>; Yes<WH5087>, they shall vow a vow<WH5088> unto the Lord<WH3068>, and perform it<WH7999>.

And the Lord<WH3068> shall strike<WH5062> Egypt<WH4714>: he shall strike<WH5062> and heal<WH7495> it<WH7725>: and they shall return even to the Lord<WH3068>, and he shall be entreated<WH6279> of them<WH7495>, and shall heal them.

In that day<WH3117> shall there be a highway<WH4546> out of Egypt<WH4714> to Assyria<WH804>, and the Assyrian<WH804> shall come<WH935> into Egypt<WH4714>, and the Egyptian<WH4714> into Assyria<WH804>, and the Egyptians<WH4714> shall serve<WH5647> with the Assyrians<WH804>.
In that day<WH3117> shall Israel<WH3478> be the third<WH7992> with Egypt<WH4714> and with Assyria<WH804>, even a blessing<WH1293> in the midst<WH7130> of the land<WH776>:

Whom the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> shall bless<WH1288>, saying<WH559>, Blessed<WH1288> be Egypt<WH4714> my people<WH5971>, and Assyria<WH804> the work<WH4639> of my hands<WH3027>, and Israel<WH3478> my inheritance<WH5159>.
